definition: to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to bleach
to float/to drift
elegant/polished
to anchor/touch at/to moor
lake/Taiwan pr. [bo2]

sentences.english: Wandering is one of the main themes in TIAN Han's early plays.
sentences.chinese: 漂泊是田汉早期剧作主题之一。

sentences.english: He turns you adrift on the world with surprising alacrity.
sentences.chinese: 他以令人惊奇的喜爱任你在世上漂泊。

sentences.english: Lewis. A Mars rampant with life. A water-covered Venus populated with floating, living islands.
sentences.chinese: 水覆盖下的金星移居来一些漂泊的栖身用的“岛屿”。

sentences.english: She lived a vagabond life in the constant presence of the couple accused of abducting her.
sentences.chinese: 她跟绑架她的人一起过著漂泊的生活。

sentences.english: Life can drift, can alone, but the soul has to be a refuge.
sentences.chinese: 生活可以漂泊，可以孤独，但灵魂必须有所归依。

sentences.english: Beipiao is also a life style of being a drifter in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北漂也指漂泊在北京的一种生存方式。

sentences.english: The right to errancy is indelibly written into democracy.
sentences.chinese: 漂泊的权利难以磨灭地写入了民主之中。

sentences.english: The ship drifted helplessly for a time.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船孤零无依地漂泊了一阵子。

sentences.english: The drifter swiftly shifted the gift to the left of the lift.
sentences.chinese: 那个漂泊者敏捷地将礼物换到电梯的左边。

sentences.english: Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me.
sentences.chinese: 送过来吧这些无家可归的，四处漂泊的的人。

sentences.english: I admired him with support. One should wander in a distant place in youth.
sentences.chinese: 我羡慕他，也支持他，年轻时就应该去远方漂泊。

sentences.english: Wandering the wind blowing from afar, the empty horizon.
sentences.chinese: 漂泊的风从远方吹来，空寂的天边。

sentences.english: In the past years, is wandering footsteps, mature is the soul.
sentences.chinese: 经年过往，漂泊的是脚步，成熟的却是心灵。

sentences.english: Wandering around a mouse in the pagoda on top of an home.
sentences.chinese: 一只四处漂泊的老鼠在佛塔顶上安了家。

sentences.english: She published prose anthology "Drifting Family", etc.
sentences.chinese: 著有散文集《漂泊的家庭》等。

sentences.english: But in the vast world and wavy life I could not find such a person.
sentences.chinese: 但茫茫人海，漂泊人生，我始终没能寻到那个人。

definition: variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
foreign land/a place far from home
to leave one's homeland
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
person living or traveling far from home
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to live abroad/to be traveling/traveler
foreign land/away from one's native place
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
variant of 飄零|飘零[piao1 ling2]
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
stranger
